title: 103_hr890
content: AMENDMENTS RELATING TO TREATMENT OF UNCLAIMED DEPOSITS AT INSURED BANKS AND SAVINGS ASSOCIATIONS. Subsection (e) of section 12 of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act (12 U.S.C. 1822(e)) is amended to include provisions for the disposition of unclaimed deposits. The Corporation is required to send two written notices to insured depositors to claim their deposits within specific timeframes. The Corporation must send two written notices to insured depositors to claim their deposits within specific timeframes. If a depositor fails to claim their deposit within 18 months, the deposit will be refunded to the Corporation or delivered to the appropriate State as unclaimed property. If the appropriate State declines to accept custody of the deposit, it will not be delivered to any State. The insured depositor must claim the deposit from the Corporation before the receivership is terminated, or all rights will be barred. United States deposits will be delivered to the Secretary of the Treasury for deposit in the general fund. Upon delivery to the Secretary of the Treasury, all depositor rights against the Corporation are barred. If a depositor does not claim the deposit within 10 years, it reverts to the Corporation. The term 'transferee institution' refers to the insured depository institution where the Corporation has made deposits. The term 'appropriate State' refers to the state where notice was mailed, or the state where the defaulting institution is located. 'United States deposit' means a deposit held by the US government or its agencies. SEC. 2. EFFECTIVE DATE. The amendments in this Act apply to institutions where the Corporation has initiated payment of insured deposits after the enactment date. Section 12(e) of the Federal Deposit Insurance Act applies to insured deposits in institutions where the Corporation was appointed receiver between January 1, 1989, and the enactment date, allowing claims by insured depositors for insured or transferred deposits before receivership termination. Information must be provided to states within 120 days of the enactment date. Within 120 days of enactment, the Corporation must provide States with the name and address of insured depositors eligible to make claims. The term "Corporation" refers to the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, the Resolution Trust Corporation, or the Federal Savings and Loan Insurance Corporation.
